inn1.comm: he starts quietly enough against the gun, Tamim Iqbal, who casually pushes into the covers
good ball here from Anderson, touch of pace and bounce, Tamim hops to defend
Tamim is off! Not the crunching cut shot, just a very simple flick off his hip to fine fine leg for a boundary
and there was the big cut shot, but it came off the toe end of the bat and went to point
good delivery here, back of a length, Tamim rocks on to the bat foot and defends
cracking stuff here, this leapt from a good length, Tamim judged a very good leave, and Kieswetter took an excellent take
good start from Shahzad, on a length and line and defended
nicely bowled again, fullish and straight and Kayes defends back to the bowler
Shahzad generating some good pace already, England do need to find an opening bowler in one-day cricket who can take new-ball wickets, Kayes defends
this time it's pushed away for a single into the leg side, tidy start from Kayes
Shahzad round the wicket to Tamim, desperate not to give any room outside off, over adjusts and Tamim whips him to square leg for one
back to full and straight to Kayes and blocked
flash and a miss outside off stump, Anderson threw it up full and invited a drive, Tamim obliged but missed
lovely shot, he's a difficult man to bowl to Tamim, he's very strong off his legs and demon against any width, this was just a fraction leg-sided and he whipped it in front of midwicket for four
just a touch of width here, Tamim looking for a cut shot, but it's too close for the shot
this time on it's on a length and line and defended
nicely played here, this is what the other Bangladesh players need to learn how to do, it tucked him up but he deflected it behind square on the leg side for a single
outside off stump here and Kayes thinks about a shot before deciding to leave
good ball from Shahzad, that's pretty much the only place to bowl to him, on a length, angling in at off stump from round the wicket, Tamim can only defend
good stuff from Shahzad, beats Tamim outside off, round the wicket angle, pitching just outside off and holding it's line, Tamim drives but misses
beaten again, though this time it was lack of bounce that defeated him, we've seen a few fly through but this kept a bit low outside off as Tamim missed a defensive block
good cricket here, full and straight and Tamim defends

lovely shot and even better fielding! Tamim wheeled a pull shot down towards the fine-leg boundary, Luke Wright ran, ran and slid a long way to pull off an excellent one-handed save on the boundary edge
this time it's a routine work to fine leg for another single
dished up much wider by Anderson, had Tamim looking for an expansive cut shot, but he couldn't reach it
Anderson switches to round the wicket and is greeted by a lovely cut shot. It was only a touch shot but Tamim worked it with quick-wrists placing it between point and cover for four
this time it cramps Tamim for room and he has to defend
just enough of a leg-stump angle to allow Tamim to whip behind square for one
this time it's Kayes who flashes a cut shot, but only finds thin air
tight channel outside off stump and left alone

gone! Huge wicket that! Tamim falls. What a shame for the crowd today. It was outside off, just offering to move away from the left hander again and Tamim aimed a drive but could only feather an edge, Kieswetter took a tumbling catch, diving low to his left
good ball first up to the new batsman, forces him into a hurried defence
full and straight once more to the new man, it thuds off the pads into the square leg region for a single
just a fraction leg-sided from Shahzad, allows an easy work to leg to Kayes
this is an excellent delivery, Siddique was trying to work it to square leg but it pitched and moved away, almost found a leading edge
good end to a good, wicket-taking over, Siddique hurries into a defence. Shahzad gets warm applause for his successful over
crunching back-foot drive to a length ball outside off, but it finds the cover fielder
oh dear, this is far too friendly from Anderson, floated up full outside off and is crashed through the covers for four
much better ball this time, back on a length, touch of away movement and beats Kayes outside off
Anderson this time fires it in on a length and it's blocked
this won't improve Anderson's mood, he banged it in a touch short, Kayes ducks and it's wided

missed by Shahzad I would say dropped, but he didn't even get a hand to it! Strange shot, open-faced guide towards short third man, Shahzad was in a odd position, neither catching nor saving runs and it went in the air straight through him! Poor old Jimmy
this time it's casually worked away for a single
Shahzad gets a chance to make up for his miss in this over and starts well enough, full and straight and defended
shoved down the leg side and Shahzad will have to bowl this again
back on to a good line and Kayes rocks forward to defend
poor delivery this, was lucky it was only a wide, short and shoved down leg, the attempted pull shot was missed
worked from a full length and clipped in to the midwicket region for a single
nothing on offer here, tight line and good length and defended
once again it's a good line, Shahzad probing this off-stump channel very well, defended
he's looked very good so far Shahzad, aside from the odd delivery he's maintained a tight length and line
starts tidily, just outside off stump on a fullish length and defended
nicely done by Kayes, dabbed off the hip for a swift single
Siddique is still stuck on zero, defending this gently into the covers
and he's away now, upper-cutting a shortish ball to third man for a single
Kayes looks organised, but not threatening, needs to find a way to rotate singles, instead it's blocked with hard hands into the covers
once again very firmly defended off the back foot
good shot here, couple of ooohs from the England fielders but it was well out of reach of the diving midwicket fielder, chipped into the leg side for a couple
Shahzad may have asked for this but Siddique played it nicely, it was a touch overpitched outside off and Siddique creamed a straight drive wide of mid off four for
back on to better length and defended quietly
lovely shot, this time Siddique went through with the leg-side clip, playing it firmly and finding the midwicket boundary
Shahzad switches back to over the wicket, to try and restrict the angle, but Siddique plays a lovely full-faced push that is timed superbly and races back past the bowler for four
this time it's full and straight and crashes into Siddique's pads, but it pitched outside leg so the appeal is pointless
Broad delivers it and it's, full, straight and defended
nothing on offer here either, just quietly defended
poor shot this, short and wide but Kayes aimed a tame pat to third man, it got high on the bat and he ended up steering it one-bounce to slip
banged in much shorter, Kayes aims a massive pull shot but it's well over his head

oh no! Shahzad misses again! Kayes jumped down the wicket and aimed a booming drive outside off, ended up slicing an outside edge high the air down to third man where Shahzad ran in, and watched it alarm as it sailed over his head, once bounce for four!
no alarm here, worked away for a single

he starts well enough, but a misfield allows an extra run, it was worked off the hip behind square on the leg side, routine single but a needless throw came it, cannoned off the stumps and went for a an extra
this time Kayes solidly defends
back of a length and on leg-stump, worked to midwicket for a single
lovely shot, wasn't a half-volley, Siddique just leant into a square-drive, raced away to the point boundary
having taken the boundary he is happy to defend
this time it's a touch leg-sided and worked away for one
Bangladesh will be very pleased with how they've gone after Tamim's fall, aside from a couple of alarms they've looked at east, here it's defended off the front foot
touch shorter, left alone outside off stump
Broad staying back of a length and it's worked calmly down to third man for a single
useful delivery, short and quick, fends it round the corner
good delivery here, Siddique took a peppering in the first game, and this is short and leaps at him outside off

out this time! Looks unlucky for Siddique! It was short once more, down the leg side, Siddique tried to work it down to fine leg, but looked like he's missed it. Massive appeal is given, sounds like it got a faint glove on the way down. Strangle, but a good decision.
Wright continues well enough, and it's defended
once more it's full and straight and defended
Wright drifts too far down the leg side and will have to bowl this agin
worked into the leg side for a single
good ball this time, probing the off-stump channel and beating the batsman outside off
outside off here, far enough to allow a leave
similar ball to finish, outside off and left alone
Broad starts tidily enough, banging on to a length and line and defended in a hurry
this is an ugly delivery, speared well down the leg side
Broad adjusts his line and length, going full outside off and is picked off for a single down to deep point
nicely bowled, Broad finding some good carry and Jahurul fends it down to square leg for one
this is a touch too far down the leg side and tickled round the corner for a single
predictably it was short and Jahurul fends it away uncomfortably
short once more but it's easily worked towards mid on. Also it was a no ball which means...Free hit
Kayes connects very well,  firmly clubbing a short ball but straight to the deep square leg
Kayes looks fairly comfortable, defending into the off side
this time Kayes happily works into some space and collects a single
nicely bowled, full and straight and Jahurul has to defend
nothing on offer here for Jahurul, he can only defend
touch fuller from Wright, Jahurul tries to work it into the leg side but can't connect
bit short, Jahurul gets into a pull shot quickly but Wright's skiddy pace means it's not quite timed perfectly. Still, useful couple there for Jahurul.
nicely played by Kayes, rode the bounce and played it down towards point where Collingwood fields well
nicely bowled by Broad, he really looks a stronger bowler after his enforced time out the side, this leapt up at Kayes, who dropped his hands well to let it go
nicely played again, riding the bounce and dropping it into leg side for a single

well, it wasn't quite how he planned it but Jahurul can be pleased, Broad shoved it in short from round the wicket, Jahurul swished a big hook shot which flew off the top edge and sailed for six behind square leg
short again and Jahurul is happy to pull again, not quite timed but he got plenty of it and it runs towards the boundary at straightish midwicket
very good from Kayes, slower ball is full and he played it with soft hands to mid off, scampering through for a single
starts by flighting one from over the wicket, worked to point for a single
switches to round the wicket to the right hander and is picked off into the leg side for a single
nothing for Kayes here, just forward and defending
worked off the front foot straight to the square leg fielder
this time it's worked just in front of square leg and allows time for a swift single
very studiously defended off the front foot  to end the over
Wright starts as well from this end as he did the other, good length and line and defended
Kayes advanced down the wicket and aims a big heave outside off, finds nothing and there's a gentle appeal from Wright
arrowed well down the leg side and he'll have to bowl that again
oops, not smart that, driven on the up to extra cover where Anderson half stopped it, Broad picked up the ball and hurled it at the bowler's end where they get an overthrow off the richochet
routinely worked down to third man for another single

oh no! Shahzad again! Jahurul aimed a massive drive down the ground and could not have timed it worse, it looped towards mid off where Shahzad was on his heels, probably thinking the ball had been timed better, ended up lolling to him on the bounce
punched off the backfoot to cover
flicked with the spin to mid wicket
pushed wide of mid wicket for a gentle single
England have looked a bit lazy and sloppy today and the field and are being punished here, worked towards midwicket and the throw came it very wide and went for an extra
this time there is nothing on offer for Jahurul, quietly defended
darted in from wide of the crease, Jahurul blocks
another very careful forward block
Kayes looks quite comfortable at the moment, here he just stretches forward and opens the face to slide this down to third man for a single
Jahurul is certainly riding his luck here, skipping down the crease and slicing an inside-out drive one-bounce down to deep cover. Wright smiles and Jahurul smiles back. How lovely
Kayes almost looks serene, just easing away another single to midwicket
nicely driven off the front foot but straight to the mid on fielder
this time he does get the single, turned to midwicket

more good work from Kayes, perhaps it was a little more edgy than he wanted to, but it was short and wide and cut finely for four. Luke Wright, who has the face every grandmother wants to see their granddaughter with, tries to sledge. Looks unnatural
Yardy continues his good work, and nothing on offer for Jahurul
Jahurul Islam pulls it wide of deep mid wicket for a single
patted into the leg side, but straight to the fielder
touch quicker from Yardy, Kayes defends
worked to square leg this time, but no run is available
single here, it was a touch fuller allowing Kayes to flick it behind square
too wide from Wright outside off, Kayes reaches for it and times a guide nicely down to third man for a single
too wide of the right hander this time and it's guided away again, this time by Jahurul, to third man
well, he can't seem to get it right. Too wide, and guided to third man. Again.
finally tightens up his line as Jahurul skips down the wicket, another single though, but this time driven crisply to deep cover
slower ball and Kayes should have found a gap here, instead he strokes it straight to cover
wrong line again, this time too far down the leg side, and worked behind square on the leg side for another single
neatly played, guided to midwicket, but Strauss is there
fired down the leg side from Yardy, brushes the pads and runs away to fine leg to bring up the 50 stand off 63 balls. Very good stuff
nicely milked, this is all Bangladesh need to do, pushed to long off for a swift single
good delivery, off-stump line, and it's pushed to short third man
touch fuller, pushed too firmly to mid on for a single
no single here either, played with hard hands to midwicket
very gentle from Collingwood, very gentle indeed, and nibbled to square leg for a single
good single taken, Jahurul pushing gently to point and running swiftly though for a single
Collingwood is pretty much bowling off breaks here, Kayes feathers it into the covers and takes a single
this one spins a fraction, into Jahurul who can't find a single with a leg-side work
dot ball once more, pushed to point and a throw comes in in a hurry
single this time, worked into a similar region behind square on the off side, single taken this time
touch too short from Yardy, Jahurul gets back and drives it firmly down to long on
this time Kayes tickles it in front of midwicket for a single
nothing here for Jahurul, blocked away off the front foot
once again Jahurul is a picture of diligence, blocking away
full-faced into the off side once more
nicely played this time, skipping down the wicket and clipping in front of square on the leg side
two more, flighted a fraction and driven firmly down the ground for a swift couple
nicely bowled from Collingwood, very slow indeed and blocked away
fifty up for Kayes, very well played really, dabbed into the covers for a swift single
this time it's another good offspinner that Jahurul defends
Jahurul works it away with the gentle spin to midwicket for a single
Kayes this time collects one, finding some space pulling to midwicket
quicker ball and Jahurul tries to work it to leg but can't connect firmly
Kayes edges down the wicket and works this away for a single
Jahurul advances this time, pushes to cover, thinks about a single but decides against it
gets a single this time, milking it down the ground for one
beaten! Outside off stump, Kayes aimed a big cut shot and missed
shoved down the leg side, Kayes went for a big sweep, it actually came off the arm to chip it over Kieswetter, but wides given
sweep shot connects this time, firmly and away to deep square for one
Jahurul edges down the crease and bunts it down to long on for one
good tight line from Collingwood, Jahurul pops forward and defends
very neatly done by Jahurul, got into position early and dinked it to fine fine leg, some good running and bad throwing allows two
Jahurul chips down the ground, much to the excitement of the England fielders but it goes on the bounce to long on
good middle over milking this, worked to midwicket for another strike turner
touch leg-sided and Jahurul  will be frustrated to have picked out the square leg fielder
neatly done, pushed with soft hands to point for a swift single
no movement here from the ball, but some very swift movement from the batsmen, running through a swift single to mid off
very powerfully hit to mid on, where Wright slid and fielded well, if the throw had come at the batsman's end it could have been close
no worries of reverse swing for Jahurul, he cleared he front leg and clumped this down the ground for four. Really top shot that

Jahurul  falls! Shahzad yelps with delight! Brings the end to a good innings, it was outside off and perhaps just offered to move away, Jahurul got a faint edge as he looked to defends and Kieswetter took a low chance. Big breakthrough for England, they were going nowhere
well not a great delivery to the new man, shortish and angled down the leg side, worked round the corner for a single
Shahzad finishes a good comeback over with a shortish ball that climbs at Kayes, gets the leading edge as he tries to fend it away but it loops just short of point running in
quietly defended outside off stump
oh Shakib. That is horrible. Really awful shot this, his third ball he's walked outside off stump and tried to scoop this over the keeper's head, predictably misses and it crashes into middle stump
starts quietly, defending off the front foot
flighted offspinner by Collingwood, he's the new Swann, Ashraful defends
quietly blocked away again, good line from Collingwood
Ashraful is away, tickling it round the corner for a single
tight line, back of a length, and defended back down the wicket
nicely driven on the up, but straight to the man at extra cover
cracking delivery! Rising from a length outside off stump, Ashraful stands at the crease and pushes at the ball and is lucky not to get an edge on that
banged in by Shahzad, and again he gets the ball to leap up and thump Ashraful on the glove. That's got to hurt
pushed out to deep cover off the back foot, just beating the man at point
played down towards gully off the back foot
full, and driven to extra cover
toe-ended to the fielder at extra cover once again
low, dipping full toss is flashed to backward point
Kayes finally picks the gap! A good-looking cut sends the ball racing out to cover point, where Jonathan Trott makes a good sliding stop
tapped into the gap in the covers, and they scamper through
dabbed to backward point off the front foot

dropped! That was a really difficult chance for Luke Wright at mid-off. Kayes walked down the track and thwacked a length delivery in the air to his right, Wright went airborne and got a hand to it but the ball just popped out as he hit the turf
pushed defensively to cover off the back foot
well bowled! Shahzad is giving Ashraful a good working over here, again hitting the deck hard as the batsman pushes tentatively outside off and is beaten
straighter this time, and defended to leg
angled down to third man for an ambled single
and Kayes does the same, opening the face of the bat to guide the ball past gully
just short of a good length, Kayes hops back and plays the ball down to third man
slightly fuller this time, and nudged back to the bowler from the crease
legcutter from Broad, and he finds the outer half of Ashraful's bat. The ball dropped short of Collingwood at point though. That just held up after pitching
slower ball, another cutter, and Kayes drives through cover. Didn't get hold of that one, it was there to be hit
bouncer from Broad! Ashraful rocks back to hook but the ball shoots past him in a flash. There are two men out in the deep for that shot...
short again, and this time Ashraful does get bat on it, rolling his wrists in the pull shot to send the ball out to deep square leg. Good shot, kept it down
nudged onto the leg side
speared in full on off stump, and driven to extra cover
slightly slower through the air, Ashraful dinks between cover and point and they scramble a single
reverse-swept, but the shot wasn't executed that well and the ball popped up off the glove to short third man
Yardy holds this one back a touch again and finds a hint of turn, but Ashraful guides to short third man and they take a very tight single. Had the throw hit, that would've been very close indeed
down the track and flicked to the man at square leg
Ashraful shows some aggression! Skipping down the track to a back-of-a-length delivery and cracking the ball on the up through the covers. Great shot
Broad goes fuller this time, and Ashraful responds with a fairly solid defensive push to cover
in the air... but safe! Broad sends down a bumper and Ashraful leans back in the hook but the ball takes the top edge and loops up to midwicket. Strauss sprints across but can't quite get to that
full and wide of off stump, shaping away and Ashraful leaves. That was a tempter, but Ashraful wasn't interested
full again, tapped softly to cover
Ashraful isn't having a great time against the short ball, again Broad sends down a bouncer and beats an airy hook. Actually, that was very short and Asad Rauf eventually calls wide
on a length and rising, Ashraful gets up on his toes and pushes to cover
just a touch too straight from Yardy, and Kayes works him through square leg for a single

gone! Terrible running, very amateurish. Ashraful steps to leg and chips up and over cover, the ball didn't go too far but they decided to risk a second. But the throw comes in in a flash and Ashraful is run out by three metres. They just set off blindly for the second, it was never on
Mahmudullah stretches forward to defend his first ball
fired in slightly shorter, and this time its defence off the back foot
off the inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolls to square leg and Kayes wants a run... luckily he's sent back, that would've been suicidal again
solid defence to finish the over
driven square, good shot but straight to the fielder at point
on a length, wide of off and Kayes slashes down to third man
tight line, right on off stump and Mahmudullah defends to cover. There was just a hint of away shape on the ball too
beaten! In the channel around off stump again, Mahmudullah pushes inside the line and the ball shoots past the inside edge
curving in this time, and defended from the crease to mid-on
nudged down to third man for a single to finish a good comeback over from Anderson, who was quite expensive in his opening spell
Yardy comes round the wicket and spears the ball down past leg stump, that's a wide
risky shot! Mahmudullah backed away, exposing all three stumps and chopping the ball off middle stump down to deep backward point
worked off the hip just to the left of square leg
arrowed down on middle and leg, and nudged through midwicket for one

much slower through the air, Kayes goes down and aims an expansive sweep to the leg side. But he's beaten in the flight, Kieswetter whips the bails off and appeals for the stumping, and though he did raise his back foot he had grounded it by the time the 'keeper broke the stumps
nudged to leg
down the track and punched to long-off
full and slashed in the air down to third man. Cries of "catch it!" but the ball dropped well short
on a length and straight, Mahmudullah drops the ball close in on the leg side and they immediately set off for a sharp single
Kayes charges down and swings wildly, his head in the air, and doesn't get close to hitting it. At least he's showing some aggression though, Bangladesh do need to push on
slightly too straight from Anderson, and Kayes shuffles to off to nurdle him through square leg
slightly fuller, and closer to off stump. Mahmudullah defends to cover
legcutter outside off, Mahmudullah flings his bat out with no great certainty and is well beaten. He didn't even get close to edging it
very full, a yorker really and dug out back to the bowler
wristily flicked through midwicket for a single
straight, and worked round the corner to short fine leg for a single
Kayes comes down the track and flaps the ball in the air down to long-on, falling short of Wright though
quick single taken as Mahmudullah nudges just to Anderson's right at midwicket. A direct hit would've been tight
quick ball from Yardy, he drags it down slightly short but Kayes can't connect with the swivel-pull and is struck on the pad
on a length outside off, quick and shaping away from the bat. Mahmudullah guides the ball down to third man
slightly fuller and delivered from round the wicket to the left-hander, who nudges the ball down to third man for another single
tapped straight to point
full and straight again, nudged to mid-on
dropped towards midwicket, and they scramble a quick single
Kayes gives himself some room and drives to cover, where Wright fumbles slightly to allow them through for one
slashed in the air down to third man, it went to the fielder's left and so two runs taken

and Kayes' stay finally comes to an end. Shahzad deceived him with a great slower ball, Kayes checked his drive but was through with the shot by the time the ball got to him and the ball looped up gently to Collingwood at point
Mashrafe receives a sharp yorker first ball, but manages to dig it out back to the bowler
on a length outside off, Mashrafe pushes inside the line and is beaten
fiery bouncer from Shahzad, Mashrafe weaves out of the way in a hurry
beaten again outside off, this time he was trying to force the ball on the up through the off side

pushed to point, there's some hesitation in the running and Collingwood fires a throw from point. Hang on, England are appealing here. Mahmudullah put is hand up and punched the ball away as he scrambled into the crease. The umpires decide that was in the interests of self preservation, as the ball was whizzing towards his head when he punched it away
worked through the leg side for one
on a length and straight, Mahmudullah defends back down the track
bouncer from Broad! The batsman ducked underneath it in good time though
on a length again, and Mahmudullah can only offer a defensive stroke back to the bowler
backfoot defence again to finish the over
spicy delivery from Shahzad! The ball pitched on a length just outside off and just took off, rising up past the shoulder of the bat. Great delivery, too good to edge
Mashrafe backs away to leg and aims a massive mow to leg, can't connect though
yorker from Shahzad, dug out towards midwicket and they steal a single
very full outside off, driven to cover point and that'll bring up Bangladesh's 200
quick yorker again, Mashrafe backs to leg and jams the ball down to short third man
flicked with plenty of bottom-handed wrist to square leg
drop-and-run from Mahmudullah to pick up a quick single as the ball trickles to leg
quick bouncer from Broad, and Mashrafe's knees buckle as the ball rises up to his head
another sharp bouncer from Broad, again Mashrafe ducks underneath it. That's the second of the over and so a no-ball
Mashrafe pulls and the ball is collected on the bounce by Trott at deep midwicket
slower-ball bouncer, toe-ended to midwicket
full and wide outside off, big swing and a miss from the batsman though
back-of-a-length, another slower ball and Mashrafe is struck on the midriff as he swivels to pull
full and wide of off stump, Mashrafe backs away to leg and clears the front leg out of the way, but again can't lay bat on ball
digs out a quick yorker this time, and they steal a single
clipped to square leg. The fielder, Yardy, only had one stump to aim at but his return crashed into the stumps. The batsman was in though, just
punched to off, Anderson leaps athletically to his left to stop the ball and hurls an under-arm throw at the stumps. Great fielding, apart from the throw, which gives away a single
very full, jammed out to midwicket
Mashrafe finally finds the boundary as he backs away to leg and thumps a full ball through cover. That's the first boundary for 10 overs!

slashed away down to third man, Morgan and Collingwood hare after the ball and good teamwork on the boundary saves runs, Collingwood sliding and stopping the ball, popping it up to Morgan who hurls it back in
wild heave to leg, and the resultant top-edge loops up and over Kieswetter for four
slightly short again, Mortaza tries to cut but the ball shoots past the outer edge
bouncer from Broad, and the ball follows Mashrafe as he backs away to leg
another short ball, and Mashrafe splices a pull to short midwicket
pushed to mid-off, and they scramble a single

hmm, seems there's an extra ball to be bowled! And what's more, Mortaza has punished it with a cracking lofted drive to long-off! Ah, that last bouncer was called no-ball as it was the second of the over
full, inswinging yorker and it's dug out to point
slower ball bouncer, flapped back to the bowler
low full toss thrashed out to long-on... terrible mix-up with the running and both batsmen end up at the non-striker's end. Oh dear.
slower ball bouncer first up, and for some reason Razzak just ducks underneath it
another slower ball bouncer, and it's gloved to short fine leg to get Mahmudullah back on strike
low full toss drilled firmly straight back down the wicket, the ball ricochets off the stumps and rolls down to Morgan at long-on. And that's that!

inn2.comm: good start from the bowler, but Strauss is away. Touch of gentle swing back into the left hander, Strauss tucks it away in front of square for one
Kieswetter is away first ball, he needs a decent score today, and starts nicely enough, guiding this to third man for one
touch of movement back into Strauss who stands still in his crease and defends
ooh don't bowl there, not to Strauss, touch of width and a bit short, Strauss unleashed a cut shot but for once picked out the fielder
better line this time and Strauss blocks into the covers
the England captain will keep the strike, turning this to deep square
and a good start from the bowler, floated up on a good line, Strauss defends
Strauss edges down the wicket but it's a good ball and he can only squeeze it to mid off
touch shorter, Strauss aims a cut shot but can't connect firmly
beaten this time! Shortish and it skid past Strauss's attempted cut. Good start by Razzak
this time it's worked into the leg side for a single
touch of spin, Kieswetter is forward and defending very carefully
Strauss is beaten again! Mashrafe finds a hint of nibble off the surface away from the left hander, but the length is crucial, full and it sneaks past Strauss's drive
now Strauss connects firmly on a drive but punches straight to the short extra cover fielder
good stuff from Mashrafe not giving Strauss any room, instead it's on a length and straight and defended
beaten a third time! Very good from the Bangladesh captain. Strauss strolled up the wicket a fraction, and aimed a defensive block but missed

well if Ashraful was a touch taller maybe this would have been close, it was a touch short from Mashrafe and Strauss immediately latched on to a pull shot, didn't quite time it but it easily cleared the midwicket fielder
this time Strauss swishes and it beaten again outside off
good stuff from Razzak, sliding it on with the arm, Kieswetter is forward and defending
just a fraction short and Kieswetter punishes, pull shot against the spinner, which is always good to see, didn't time it perfectly but picked the gap in front of midwicket
classic Kieswetter here, down the track and outside leg, giving himself room to unfurl a slicing drive, but picks out cover
touch of spin and slightly slower from Razzak, well bowled, Kieswetter watched it carefully and pushed it away for a single to point
shot! Nicely done from Strauss, down the ground and driving handsomely, depositing it into the crowds
this time it's a touch shorter and Strauss works it round the corner to keep the strike
carefully defended off the back foot
very correctly played by Strauss brings his blade down pendulum-straight and knocks back to the bowler
more good work from Mashrafe, giving no room away and Strauss can only defend
Mashrafe probing an off-stump line here, Strauss full-faces back down the pitch
slower ball from Mashrafe, Strauss waited on it and ran it down to third man
Kieswetter edging down the wicket, he keeps his head very still when he does that, and blocks it firmly to cover
not a good start at all, in that horror zone short and wide, Strauss could put these away blindfolded, cut through point for four
much better length, fuller, and Strauss pushes to mid off
Shafiul rightly persisting with a fuller length, Strauss squeezes it towards point
Kieswetter hit this hard to midwicket, but there is still no excuse for the misfield that occurred, allows Kieswetter to pick up two
and this time it's an open-faced guide to third man
not great bowling that, but Strauss is good to take full toll, it was up at around leg stump, Strauss clipped firmly, in front of midwicket for another boundary
unlucky for Mashrafe, he drew a leading edge from Kieswetter as the batsman tried to clip it into leg side, it ended up going down to third man
a touch too far down the leg side, Strauss tucks it away fine for a regulation four
back of a length but a good line and Strauss can only defend
Strauss on the cut again, but it bounced a fraction more than he thought which meant he could not time the shot

oh dear, a horrible mix up. Strauss is just home after dabbing it to square of the wicket on the off side, Kieswetter called through for one and almost met Strauss at the batsman's end, eventually Strauss ran through but the throw was poor and by the time the bowler collected and under-armed on to the stumps Strauss was home. Relief for Kieswetter, Strauss would not have been pleased at all
woosh! Nicely done by Kieswetter. That's what he's there for, skipping down the wicket and smashing a drive straight back over the bowler's head for six into the stands
starts well, full outside off, Strauss defends into the covers
just outside off stump, pushed square of the wicket, a booming "NO" from Kieswetter resonates round the ground
very good from Strauss, very good indeed, edging down the wicket and nailing an extra-cover drive for four
this time it's a touch short and Strauss gets wheels a pull shot away with his glove, goes down to fine leg where some sliding work saves the boundary

Strauss falls! Shame for the England captain, he was looking very good but joy for Rubel! It was short and, with third man up, Strauss tried to help it over the slips for four, but it bounced more than he expected and he could only end up feathering it through to Jahurul behind the stumps
good ball first up from Rubel outside off stump, full length and left alone by Trott
good start, full, straight, Kieswetter blocks
good again, he's an excellent performer with the ball, doesn't give much away, Kieswetter blocks
drags his length back a bit but the same result
slung into Kieswetter's pads, runs away for a single to midwicket to bring up the England 50
Beaten! Top stuff from Shakib, drawing Trott forward, it pitches and rips past the defensive outside edge
lovely response from Trott, we saw plenty of this during his double hundred, it was a fraction overpitched and Trott stroked an extra-cover drive away perfectly
too short, too wide, and four. Nicely done by Kieswetter, stands tall and wristily flashes it behind point for four
Rubel strikes again! Double for him! Decent pace outside off, Kieswetter flashes a drive  and but ends up edging it behind. Another disappointing score for Kieswetter, but he looked good
Massive appeal from Bangladesh. Huge appeal not given. Another flashing blade outside off, sounded like a big nick, it was a big nick. Very very unlucky there for Rubel and Bangladesh
this time it's pushed away into the off side for a single
nothing here for Trott, carefully pushed back to the bowler
good ball, finding some decent bounce and Trott works a pull shot away well, in front of midwicket
Collingwood pushes his first ball back to the bowler, he's very lucky to be there
good stuff from Mashrafe, on a length and line and Collingwood blocks
touch fuller this time, Collingwood pushes to midwicket
good ball here from Mashrafe, and plenty of chat from the Bangladesh fielders, it pitched and left Collingwood, who fenced at it outside off
this time it's shorter and on Collingwood's hips, tucked away for a single
Trott this time tucks it away, neatly for a single to fine leg
Rubel working up good pace and decent carry too, Trott hurries into a solid defence
lovely timing from Trott, really well played, it was angled into his body and he flicked it in front of midwicket, looked like two bit sped to the boundary
almost done it again! Wide outside off and Trott played and missed a cut
good carry again outside off, Trott leaves alone
short once more, Trott hops into a pull shot and it goes to square leg for a single
good stuff from Rubel, good pace and aggression, this time it's full and straight and Collingwood digs it out
bit of an appeal here as it thuds into Collingwood's pads, but it's heading way down the leg side
touch shorter and Trott pats it to mid on for a swift single
frustrating misfield at midwicket allows Collingwood a single as he nudged into the leg side
this is outside off and Trott aims a cut but it's too close and he can't time it
touch fuller and he defends
Trott tries to work it into the leg side, but can't connect and it thuds into his thigh
Rubel continuing with his pacey slingers, Collingwood toe-ends a cut
this time it's closer to off stump from Rubel and defended
it's good bowling this, really good stuff, full and outside off stump, Collingwood can only defend
probing the off-stump channel, Collingwood solidly behind it again
slower ball from Rubel, much slower, Collingwood defends
oh dear! Ruined a good over, attempted yorker is flung way down the leg side, landed in the footholes and leapt over the keeper for five wides
good ball to finish, back on full and straight and defended
Mashrafe continues and Trott is very studiously behind a back-foot defence
angled down the leg side a fraction and Trott whips it away for a couple to backwards square leg
outside off stump, enough room for Trott to cut, not enough room for him to time it
if my Bengali translation is correct, the Bangladesh fielders are telling their captain this "looks good" it does, with Trott defending outside off
once again, Trott is on the back foot and blocking away
good end to a decent over from Mashrafe, on off stump, Trott defends
slung down on a length, and shaping away from Collingwood, who forces off the back foot into the covers
fuller and straighter this time, and nudged to mid-on
Rubel bangs it in short again, and Collingwood pounces on it, leaning back to aim a rifling pull shot up and over midwicket!
driven on the up towards cover
Rubel hurls one down towards leg stump, Collingwood clips to leg but finds midwicket
a touch of extra bounce outside off to finish, but Collingwood reacts quickly to stand up tall and play the ball down
width offered as Razzak comes round the wicket, and it's an easy single as the ball is driven out to deep cover
straighter this time, and quicker through the air. Punched to extra cover off the back foot
Collingwood makes some room and slaps the ball through the covers
full and straight, Trott leans forward to defend
Razzak slips towards leg stump, Trott flicks him behind square to rotate the strike

Collingwood goes! Huge appeal for lbw as Razzak spears one towards middle and leg. Ooh, that's a bit of a shocker from the umpire, there was a massive inside edge off the bat into the pad. But he's got to go! Well, seems Shane was right!
full on leg stump, and Trott flicks elegantly out to deep midwicket
Trott aims a punchy drive through cover, but doesn't quite time it and the ball rolls to cover
on a length just outside off, Trott shuffles across and nudges to mid-on
seaming in quite sharply, but the ball started straight and slipped towards leg stump and is clipped to midwicket
full, angling across Morgan who raises his bat up to leave
edged! Flashing drive from Morgan to a full ball outside off, he got a thick edge which flew through second/third slip and down to third man

Morgan goes! England are wobbling now! Razzak speared one down flat and fast, Morgan tries to flick to midwicket across the line but misses and is struck on the pad infront of middle. Good decision, that was hitting the top of middle.
tossed up outside off, Yardy is off the mark straight away with a clumpy drive through cover
that looked slightly quicker through the air, Yardy defends to cover
floated up on middle and leg, Yardy drives down to long-on
tight lines from Razzak, who comes round the wicket to Trott and sends the ball down on middle and leg. Solid defence
big turn! Razzak lands a beauty on middle and leg, the ball really grips and turns past the outside edge of Trott's bat. Trott was playing back, he should've been forward. Great ball though
on a length, angling across Yardy who leaves well alone
similar ball, this time Yardy chops to point
slightly fuller, and wider still. Again Yardy leaves
good ball, tight on the line of off stump and Yardy hops back to defend to cover point
full, wide, pitching outside off and going further away with the angle. Left alone
on a length, chopped to point once again and that's a maiden for Shafiul.
tossed up very high on middle and leg, and turned to midwicket off the front foot
spinning in from off to leg, clipped straight to the midwicket fielder
flicked across to leg once again, this time just to the left of the fielder and they pick up a single
Trott stays deep in the crease and punches to cover
full on middle and off, Yardy eases the ball out to long-on
Trott steps back and across and works the ball to wide midwicket for one
bad line from Shafiul, and he's punished for it. He speared the ball down the leg side, Trott tried to tickle it round the corner but got some thighpad on the ball to send it to fine leg
much better, on a length on off stump and tapped back to the bowler
fuller this time, Trott moves across to off and aims a good-looking drive straight to mid-on
wide of off stump this time, and just going straight on rather than seaming in as the last few deliveries had. Trott leaves
full outside off again, this time Trott slams a drive... but straight to extra cover
length delivery to finish, and Trott taps it back to the bowler.
angled down to short third man. They briefly think about a run, but Trott wisely says no
slightly straighter, and turned to midwicket
well, Yardy was setting himself for the paddle-sweep but Razzak sent the ball down very wide of off and so the batsman changed his mind and toe-ended to cover
a touch too short, and Yardy hops back in a flash to muscle a pull out to deep midwicket
arrowed at leg stump, Trott glances to fine leg but there's a man at short fine
same again, Razzak aims at leg stump and Trott turns the ball to short fine leg. No run
cracking drive out to deep cover, but even better fielding on the boundary as the fielder makes a great sliding save
full toss outside off, tapped wide of mid-off
arm ball! Yardy didn't spot it, and pushed inside the line to be beaten outside off
straighter this time, clipped to midwicket
again beaten outside off! This drifted beautifully through the air, Yardy went back to cut but the ball shot past the top edge
full outside off, and driven to extra cover
good length on off stump, Trott pushes back to the bowler
there's definitely some turn every now and then, again Razzak tweaks one but Trott covers it well
too much width, and Trott cuts out to deep cover for two
not all that short, but Trott picked the length really early, staying deep in the crease and sending the ball to the deep midwicket boundary with a neat short-arm jab. Great timing and placement
full on leg stump, Trott goes down to sweep but can't connect
full again, the ball squirts off the inner half of the bat and goes to midwicket
sent down wide of off stump, Yardy chops out to point
Trott is slightly squared up as Shakib turns one from middle and leg
too straight, this one didn't turn and was easily nudged to midwicket
tight on off stump from round the wicket, Yardy drives back to the bowler

bowled 'im! Again, that wasn't too short but Yardy seemed to be trying to emulate Trott's shot from the last over. He hopped back to pull but the ball shot under the bat and cannoned into the off stump. That was quicker through the air and delivered with a very low arm. Bangladesh strike again!
Wright lunges out to defend first ball
full and flighted on leg stump, clipped to straight midwicket
inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolls to short fine leg. Oohs and Aahs from the Bangladesh fielders
huge appeal for lbw! Big inside edge on that though, and the umpire says "no"
too short, too wide, slapped out to cover point
on a length on middle and off, Trott steps back to defend
tapped to extra cover off the back foot
delivered from wide of the crease as Shakib stays round the wicket. Wright defends
pushed defensively to point
nudged to midwicket, tight ring of fielders in the circle
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
dragged down short on leg stump, Wright works the ball off the hip behind square on the leg side
full on leg stump, clipped wide of square leg and Trott keeps strike
short on off stump, Trott shuffles back and across and rolls his wrists over a pull to send the ball to midwicket
on a length on middle and off, Wright taps to mid-on, who is much too deep, and they scramble a single. Rubel's not happy, he wants the fielder closer in

beaten! Great delivery from Rubel, who finds shape away from the bat as he sends the ball down on a length. Trott pushes inside the line and is well beaten. Appeal from the 'keeper, but Rubel wasn't interested, just holds his head. That was close!
pushed to mid-on, who has come up a few yards
pushed to point, and they take a quick single
Wright beaten now! Another superb ball, landing and moving away to beat the outside edge of an uncertain push by Wright.
speared down the leg side from round the wicket
and again, Trott just steps across and lets the ball go as it shoots down the leg side
now he finds his line, landing it on middle and leg as Trott pushes to long-on
Wright eases the ball down to long-on
flighted delivery just outside off, Trott presses forward to defend
full and tossed up again, this time Trott turns the ball to straight midwicket
cracked down to long-on, where the fielder fumbles, allowing them back for two
driven down to long-off
punched to mid on firmly off the back foot
touch shorter Trott flicks it to deep square leg with where another fumble allows Trott to come back for a second, just a few signs of nerves from Bangladesh
much fuller and angled into the legs, Trott tries to flick it away away and it thuds off the pads for a single
Rubel has been excellent today, really given some needle to this attack, this bounces more than Wright expected and fends it in the air down to third man where another misfield allos two
Wright flashes outside off, and finds nothing but fresh air
Rubel persisting with the channel outside off, Wright slashes hard at it but mistimes to point
this is really thrown up outside off, really floated, Trott drives it away for a single to deep cover
this time it's a touch shorter and Wright works it to long on for a single
solidly blocked into the off side
this time it's worked into the off side for a single
oh good lord. This was a shocking ball. Always the danger of bowling Ashraful, waist high full toss Wright could clatter it anywhere and smashes it miles over deep midwicket for six
this is a short ball that Wright misses out on, mistiming his cut
fired in from wide of the crease, Trott misses an attempted work to leg and there is a gentle appeal as it hits his pads, heading well down though
similar angle, but this time Trott connects and nibbles it to midwicket
this has been a good first half to the over, tight off stump line, Trott cuts but picks out the fielder at cover
very good again from Shafiul, not erring in length or line, Trott works it to midwicket but nothing on offer
he's really putting everything into this, really firing it in from wide of the crease, Trott can't get it away
top over! Really good time to bowl a maiden there. Angled into Trott once more and he can only defend
big innings this for Wright, he hasn't fired with the bat for a while, here he cuts a short ball firmly to deep point
ooh, well bowled, slider-type ball from Shakib almost got through, Trott jabs it out
fired in from a low arm into Trott's pads and he defends
this time he gets a single, worked into space
Wright is forward and full-facing back to the bowler
Wright aims a drive, it runs off the inside edge on to the leg side for a single

and the slip takes it! Top work from Bangladesh and brilliant stuff from Shafiul! What a good job he's done in his last few overs, it was full outside off, Wright flashed a drive it flew quickly but straight to slip who juggled the chance, before taking it one handed. Bangladesh in charge here!
Ajmal Shahzad is the new man, tense stuff out there, he gets into line from a stance well outside leg stump and defends, collecting a single towards cover
good ball again, zippy and hurrying Trott into a defensive push
full, straight and pacey again, Trott pops forward and defends
rare loose ball, angled too far down the leg side
touch of extra bounce, plenty of chat in English and Bengali from the Bangladesh fielders, they're very excited, Trott hops back and defends
nicely played, just back of a length Trott guides it to point for a single
nicely slung in from Shakib, cramping Trott for room as he gets forward and defends
Trott pats this back down the wicket, Shakib tries to field off his bowling but crashes into Shahzad
enough width outside off to allow Trott to tap it into the covers and take a single
Shahzad gets into a good position to defend on the front foot
another good ball, drifting into the legs, Shahzad defends
another good quicker ball, Shahzad aiming to cut but it's a dangerous shot against Shakib as it skids on, he gets a bottom edge
Trott needs to find a way of shifting the run of play here, Bangladesh are in control, it's short and straight and pushed back to the bowler
slower ball from Shafiul, thrown up outside off, good thinking but Trott watches it carefully and drives to cover
good running here, they need more of this, guided to deep point and Trott races off for two
Shafiul is doing very well here for Bangladesh, choking England, Trott can only defend

having just said that Shafiul dishes up a half volley, Trott plays a very crisp and well-timed drive through extra-cover for four to bring up his 50. Good innings but he has a long way to go to make it a useful one
keeps the strike well here, guiding towards third man for a single
oh this will annoy Trott, it was fired down the leg side but his sweep shot finds the one fielder - short fine leg
just a single here, pushed to mid on for a single
nicely played by Shahzad, wirstily punched through extra cover for a single
Trott taps this towards cover
good shot here, milking down the ground for one
Shahzad joins the milk-fest, shoving it down to long on
single taken, just, as Shahzad inside-edges it towards square leg
touch of extra bounce and some spin, Trott leaves it alone
this time Trott tries to nudge it away behind square on the off side but finds the fielder
touch too far down the leg side, allows Trott to heave a sweep away, connects nicely and collects a single to deep square
good shot here, working a straight ball to long on for one
Shahzad had very little idea about this, aiming a push towards cover it skews off an inside edge through midwicket
Shakib strikes again! Another skidding delivery, Shahzad aimed a big pull shot but it crept under the bat, hit his pad and cannoned into the stumps. Bangladesh almost there now!
starts edgily here, aiming a dab sweep that he connects with only slightly and gets one
Trott continues to work hard, blocking studiously off the front foot
driven this time, but straight to cover
huzzah! how about this from Trott? Reverse sweep, plays it very well and collects four
touch shorter this time, keeps low and Trott blocks
on a length on off stump, Broad leans back and pushes to extra cover
slightly wider of off this time, Broad slashes past point but the cover sweeper cleans up
on the legs, and Trott glances down to fine leg. Great running fetches England two runs
full, and just snaking in through the air. Trott drives to mid-on
short outside off, Trott flat-bats the ball to midwicket, where the fielder tumbles over to stop the ball. But they sneak a single
bouncer from Rubel, but it's just too short and called wide as it loops over Broad's head
full, wide, Broad slashes a square drive past point and they run two as third man runs round to cut it off. Good over for England
chopped between cover and point, and they scramble a single
length on off stump, Broad just aims a defensive push into the off side, but the ball pings off the middle of the bat and they take one to long-off
tapped down to long-on, England are edging closer
solid-looking forward defence from Broad, no single this time as the ball goes to extra cover
back-of-a-length and straight, Broad nudges off his hip to midwicket
straight again, and once again Broad flicks to the man at midwicket
speared down the leg side, the 'keeper fumbles and they snatch a quick single
full and on the toes, Broad clips to square leg
nudged to square leg from Trott, the ball didn't go very far so no single
on leg stump again, this time Trott sends the ball behind square on the leg side
nice and tight from Razzak, Broad shuffles across and flicks to midwicket
Broad plays across his front pad to pick up a single on the leg side
looped up on middle and off, Trott taps to extra cover
wide of off stump, Broad slashes but can't get bat on it and Shafiul's been wided.
on a length on off stump, Broad pushes the ball to extra cover off the back foot
four runs! Another length delivery, just outside off, and Broad slaps it on the up through cover. Game on!
low full toss just outside off, but Broad can't capitalise, driving straight to the man on the edge of the circle in the covers
big swish from Broad to a length delivery just outside off, the ball shoots off the inner half of the bat and rolls into the leg side

great drive from Broad, all poise and high left elbow... but straight to the fielder at cover again. The fielder fires in a return throw to the non-striker's end, direct hit and the umpire goes upstairs... not out, Trott was easily home.
speared at the pad, the ball trickles to the leg side and they charge through for a single.
full, just outside off and driven hard out to the cover sweeper
tip-and-run as Trott taps to cover and they set off
play and a miss from Broad, as he pushes at a ball outside off stump!
riposte! Broad swings through the line to send the ball sailing away over deep midwicket. Huge hit! That will ease the pressure
full on the off stump and driven hard to the cover fielder in the circle
driven to cover once again, this time they take a single. Shy at the stumps as Broad slides in, but wide of the mark
low, dipping full toss clipped to midwicket, a quick single is taken
phew! Close! Trott heaves to leg but misses completely, and the ball misses the off stump by a whisker
boundary! Trott skips down the track to turn the ball into a full toss and flicks out to deep midwicket. Great timing on the shot!
tight on off stump, Trott defends to cover
Trott gives himself some room and drills out to long-on
ooh, that's loose! Shakib fires one down the leg side, that's a wide
driven down to long-on

gone! Broad falls! The ball was full and wide and Broad threw the bat at it, getting a good connection but slicing the ball in the air to backward point where Shakib leaps to pluck it out of the air. This is going down to the wire
tip-and-run from Anderson, just pushing to cover and Trott calls him through straight away. Nervy stuff!
on a length and straight, Trott hops back and whips out to deep midwicket
good ball! Full and straight, wobbling through the air on the way down, and Anderson defends back to the bowler
beaten! This was very full, swerving away through the air and scooting under Anderson's loose drive
full again, Anderson pushes back to the bowler
full, straight and swinging in, Trott drives down to long-on
beaten! On a length just outside off, Anderson pushed at it but the ball seamed away to beat the edge. Burst of approving cheers from Bangladesh's supporters
tight single! Anderson clips to midwicket and Trott charges across, scraping home as the throw cam in
Trott backs away to leg and cracks the ball back to the bowler. All the fielders are out on the leg side, no-one protecting the cover boundary
again Trott steps to leg, but Shafiul fires down a yorker and he can only push it back to the bowler, who tumbles over to stop it and stands to give the batsman a good stare
for the third time Trott backs to leg, this time he smashes the ball into the covers but picks out the fielder on the edge of the circle!
low full toss, Trott drills it out to deep cover and they charge back for the second
pinpoint yorker! But the ball squirts off the inside edge of the ball and races to the fine leg boundary!
smashed down the ground, four more! He's standing outside leg stump and trying to open up the off side, cracking this straight back past the bowler
thumped down the ground again! Drama! The fielder fumbles and they sprint back for the second, Trott dives back into the crease. Pressure!
full toss thumped down the ground, this time the fielder picks it up cleanly so just the one, but the damage has already been done in this over
gone! Chipped back to the bowler to be caught-and-bowled. Bangladesh think it's all over, Mashrafe is roaring and they're whipping the stumps out! But Bell is going to bat
Trott heaves to wide long-on, and they charge back for the second!
again Trott swipes to leg, a little fumble by the fielder at long-on and they take two more

Gone! On a length, outside off Trott slashes and gets a healthy edge through to the 'keeper! Shafiul sprints round the field screaming, back on the balcony Siddons and the support staff are leaping and hugging each other, the whole team smiling and cheering. Now they can grab those stumps
